recipe_name: Fruit and yoghurt with homemade granola
author: The Hairy Bikers
method: Preheat the oven 200C/400F/Gas 6. Place the apples, sugar and water in a large saucepan and cook gently for 10-15 minutes, or until the apples start to break up. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.  Melt the butter in a microwave.  Place in a large bowl and stir in the oats, coconut, cinnamon and honey.  Spread the mixture onto large baking trays and cook in the oven for 7-8 minutes, or until golden-brown. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool. To serve, place the cooled apples into individual serving bowls, top with the yoghurt and sprinkle over the granola mix.
ingredients: 4kg/9lbs eating apples, peeled, cored and chopped,  250g/9oz demerara sugar ,  2 litres/3½ pints water ,  200g/7oz unsalted butter ,  800g/1lb 12oz oats ,  200g/7oz desiccated coconut ,  1 tbsp ground cinnamon ,  150g/5½oz honey ,  2kg/4lb 8oz plain yoghurt
